scenes.background: The team has successfully completed an important project, and everyone is excited to organize a celebration. However, there are differing opinions on how to celebrate. Colleague Sam suggests going to a bar for a lively party, Emma prefers a formal dinner, and Ryan proposes an outdoor team-building activity. Alex suggests a bit of everything: starting with an outdoor activity, then having dinner, and ending the night at a bar. Monica and Bob have been discussing this, and you notice some tension as they approach you. Monica crosses her arms and says, 'Alex, do you really think we can fit all that in one evening? And Bob here thinks we should just stick to one thing.' Bob nods in agreement, looking a bit annoyed. Alex insists that experiencing all three would be a memorable celebration and suggests giving it a try. Monica sighs and says, 'Alright, but what if we end up rushing through everything and no one enjoys any of it?' Bob adds, 'Yeah, and some of us might not even want to go to a bar.' Alex suggests giving it a go and adjusting as needed if they feel rushed. Monica frowns slightly and says, 'Adjusting as needed sounds risky. What if we can't make everyone happy?' Bob, scratching his head, mumbles, 'I still think a simple dinner would be less hassle.' Alex suggests sticking to the plan and being flexible.
scenes.description: Monica crosses her arms and says, 'Fine, but if things go south, don't say I didn't warn you.' Bob looks exasperated and says, 'Honestly, it's starting to sound like more trouble than it's worth.'

options.text: We can always adjust based on the situation. Let's focus on making the best out of whatever happens.
options.analysis: This option shows a high level of emotional detection and empathy by considering the concerns of both Monica and Bob. It demonstrates good social skills and motivation to reach a compromise.

options.text: I'm confident it will work out. We just need to remain adaptable and positive.
options.analysis: This choice shows good self-regulation and social skills but slightly lower empathy as it prioritizes sticking to the original plan and adapting on the fly.

options.text: Maybe we should just keep it simple to avoid any potential problems.
options.analysis: This option reflects empathy and emotional detection by considering everyone's opinion, but shows lower motivation as it avoids making a decisive call.
